meanings.definition: The theory that living organisms are fundamentally different from non-living entities due to the presence of a vital force.
meanings.sent1: In vitalism, it is thought that living things have a special energy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists debated the concept of vitalism for many years.
meanings.sent3: The idea of vitalism made the biology class more interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for gardening was like the vitalism of a blooming flower.
meanings.sent5: The essence of vitalism in nature is truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The belief that life processes are not solely explainable by physical and chemical laws.
meanings.sent1: Some people find comfort in the idea of vitalism guiding life.
meanings.sent2: Vitalism challenges the strict boundaries of science.
meanings.sent3: The notion of vitalism can spark intriguing discussions.
meanings.sent4: His creativity flowed with the vitalism of a bubbling brook.
meanings.sent5: The mystery of vitalism adds depth to our understanding of existence.
